=== Ubuntu 8.10 (Intrepid Ibex) ===
=== Ubuntu 8.10 (Intrepid Ibex) ===
{{future software}}
{{future software}}
â
[[Image:Ubuntu 8.10.png|right|thumb|Ubuntu 8.10 Alpha 5<br /> (''Intrepid Ibex'')]]
+
[[Image:Ubuntu 8.10.png|right|thumb|Ubuntu 8.10 Alpha<br /> (''Intrepid Ibex'')]]
Ubuntu 8.10 (''Intrepid Ibex''), to be released on [[2008-10-30]],<ref name="intrepid_release">{{cite web |url=https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+milestone/ubuntu-8.10|title=Milestone ubuntu-8.10 for Ubuntu due 2008-10-30|accessdate=2008-04-28}}</ref> will be Canonical's ninth release of Ubuntu.<ref name="warty_release" /> It will be supported until April 2010. Ubuntu 8.10 has several planned new features including a new default theme,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-art/2008-January/004855.html | title=Ubuntu theme update postponed | accessdate=2008-03-26}}</ref> improvements to mobile computing and desktop scalability, increased flexibility for Internet connectivity, a [[Graphical User Interface|GUI]] driven [[Live USB]] creator (possibly [[Ubuntu Live USB creator|Live USB system creator]]), a guest account<ref>{{cite web |url=https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DesktopTeam/Specs/Intrepid/GuestAccount | title=Guest account specification | accessdate=2008-08-19}}</ref>, an encrypted 'private' directory in each user's home directory<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.linuxloop.com/news/2008/07/03/top-5-new-features-of-ubuntu-810-interpid-ibex/ | title=Linux Loop:Top 5 New Features of Ubuntu 8.10 Intrepid Ibex |accessdate=2008-07-08}}</ref> and the inclusion of [[Dynamic Kernel Module Support]], a tool that allows kernel drivers to be automatically rebuilt when new kernels are released.<ref>https://wiki.ubuntu.com/IntrepidIbex/TechnicalOverview</ref>
Ubuntu 8.10 (''Intrepid Ibex''), to be released on [[2008-10-30]],<ref name="intrepid_release">{{cite web |url=https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+milestone/ubuntu-8.10|title=Milestone ubuntu-8.10 for Ubuntu due 2008-10-30|accessdate=2008-04-28}}</ref> will be Canonical's ninth release of Ubuntu.<ref name="warty_release" /> It will be supported until April 2010. Ubuntu 8.10 has several planned new features including a new default theme,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-art/2008-January/004855.html | title=Ubuntu theme update postponed | accessdate=2008-03-26}}</ref> improvements to mobile computing and desktop scalability, increased flexibility for Internet connectivity, a [[Graphical User Interface|GUI]] driven [[Live USB]] creator (possibly [[Ubuntu Live USB creator|Live USB system creator]]), a guest account<ref>{{cite web |url=https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DesktopTeam/Specs/Intrepid/GuestAccount | title=Guest account specification | accessdate=2008-08-19}}</ref>, an encrypted 'private' directory in each user's home directory<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.linuxloop.com/news/2008/07/03/top-5-new-features-of-ubuntu-810-interpid-ibex/ | title=Linux Loop:Top 5 New Features of Ubuntu 8.10 Intrepid Ibex |accessdate=2008-07-08}}</ref> and the inclusion of [[Dynamic Kernel Module Support]], a tool that allows kernel drivers to be automatically rebuilt when new kernels are released.<ref>https://wiki.ubuntu.com/IntrepidIbex/TechnicalOverview</ref>
